ParentCompanyName: Ag Chem, Inc. d/b/a UAP Northeast
OperatorName: Ag Chem, Inc. d/b/a UAP Northeast

_desc.NAICS_DESCRIPTION: Other Chemical and Allied Products Merchant Wholesalers

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
INTRODUCTION
Please contact Rich Crawford of UAP Northeast?s Girdletree MD office at 410-632-2200 or Bill Sirman, Operator, at 410-623-2398 for more information. 

UAP Northeast, its management and employees are committed to the prevention of any accidental release of anhydrous ammonia at this facility located at 7531 Queponco Road, Neward, MD 21841.  If an accidental release occurs, UAP Northeast is prepared to cooperate with the local Fire Department, LEPC, and other authorities to mitigate the release and minimize the impact to the surrounding community and environment.

The only operations at this facility are the storage and retail dispensing of anhydrous ammonia to local farmers as a nitrogen fertilizer nutrient.

FACILITY INFORMATION
The maximum quantity of product stored in only (1) 30,000-gallon tank is approximately 132,000 pounds (85% capacity limited by design standards).  Farmers transfer the product into their mobile 1000-gallon nurse tanks, which are returned immediately to their farm for land application.

WORST CASE RELEASE
The worst-case release would be the release of the entire contents of the storage tank over a 10-minute period.    The distance to the toxic endpoint would be 6.9 miles.

ALTERNATIVE RELEASE
The alternative release is based on a transfer hose failure over a 2-minute period before manual shut-off occurs.  The distance to the toxic endpoint would be 1.3 miles.

ACCIDENTAL RELEASE AND PREVTION PROGRAM
This facility utilizes accepted operating practices for anhydrous ammonia operations. The Emergency Response Plan details the steps necessary to respond to a release, including notifying the LEPC.

ACCIDENT HISTORY
There has not been an accident at this facility within the last 5 years.

EMERGENCY RESPONSE PLAN
An Emergency Response Plan has been implemented and authorities will be notified in the event of a release.  The Emergency Response Plan is distributed annually to the Fire Department and LEPC with the Tier 2 report.

PLANNED CH

ANGES
Annual evaluations are conducted and improvements are continually occurring.  UAP Northeast schedules this facility for closure by 12/2004.
